page.title: 05THE MARSHLANDS
page.content: Many mud banks fringe the tidal creeks outside the sea walls.These are mainly covered by Salicornia (Glasswort) and Aster tripolium (Sea Aster),with Halimione (Sea Purslane) and Artemesia maritima (Sea Wormwood) at the base of the walls.Shore crabs and shrimps are found in profusion in the estuarine dykes and creeks. On bare ground by paths, Lepidium ruderale (narrow leaved Pepperwort) is common and in one estuarine dyke a large colony of Dittander (Lepidium latifolium) can be found.The walls provide habitats for Torilis nodosa (Knotted Hedge Parsley),Cardus tenuiflorus (slender flowered thistle) and Beta maritima (Sea beet). The long rectangular dykes and ditches are fringed by Scirpus maritimus (Sea Club - rush) and Phragmites (Common Reed).
